intro: Hampea tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly hampea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
